com.gembox.spreadsheet.internal.inlinestyles

Class CharacterRangeFormatHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gembox.spreadsheet.internal.inlinestyles.CharacterRangeFormatHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FontDataFormatHandler, FormatHandler

    public final class CharacterRangeFormatHandler
extends Object
implements FontDataFormatHandler
    Represents a handler for font formatting which is used to decouple ExcelFont type from the font format data in the underlying storage.

      • getFontData

        public FontData getFontData()
        Description copied from interface: FontDataFormatHandler

        Gets the resolved formatting.

        Returned value is never null and modifying it won't make any changes in the underlying storage (it is either cached or cloned version of formatting from the underlying storage or it is dynamically created).

        Specified by:
        getFontData in interface FontDataFormatHandler
        Returns:
        The resolved formatting.

      • setFontData

        public void setFontData(FontData value)
        Description copied from interface: FontDataFormatHandler

        Sets the formatting.

        Input value is either cached / frozen or cloned (modifying it later won't make any changes in the underlying storage). Input value can be null, in which case formatting will be resolved from the referenced (named) style.

        Specified by:
        setFontData in interface FontDataFormatHandler
        Parameters:
        value - The formatting.

      • getFontDataValue

        public <TValue> TValue getFontDataValue(Function<FontData,TValue> selector)
        Description copied from interface: FontDataFormatHandler

        Gets the resolved formatting property value based on a selector delegate.

        Selector's argument is never null and should not be modified (it is the same instance as in the underlying storage).

        Specified by:
        getFontDataValue in interface FontDataFormatHandler
        Type Parameters:
        TValue - The type of the formatting property.
        Parameters:
        selector - The selector of the formatting property.
        Returns:
        The resolved formatting property value.

      • setFontData

        public void setFontData(Consumer<FontData> action)
        Description copied from interface: FontDataFormatHandler

        Sets the formatting property using the action delegate.

        Action's argument is never null nor frozen (it is the same instance as in the underlying storage).

        .

        Action delegate is a closure since value which will be set to formatting property is hoisted in it. A little bit of performance is sacrificed for simplicity.

        Specified by:
        setFontData in interface FontDataFormatHandler
        Parameters:
        action - The action which sets the formatting field.

      • isDifferential

        public boolean isDifferential()
        Description copied from interface: FormatHandler
        Gets a value indicating whether formatting is differential.

        If formatting is differential, then editor should always set some concrete value in concrete FormatHanlder set method; otherwise, it can set null if value is default.

        For example, if setting FontData.setItalic(java.util.Optional) and formatting is differential, only true or false value should be set. If formatting is not differential, then instead of false value, null can be set.

        Differential formatting inherits properties which are not null. Differential formatting are currently not used in GemBox.Spreadsheet, but they might soon be used (if we add support for rich text, rich text comments, conditional formatting, tables, pivot tables, auto-filter, sorting, etc.)

        Specified by:
        isDifferential in interface FormatHandler
        Returns:
        true if formatting is differential; otherwise, false.

      • getColors

        public ColorScheme getColors()
        Description copied from interface: FormatHandler
        Gets the color scheme associated with this format handler.

        Color scheme is used to convert theme and indexed (palette) colors to RGB format.

        If format handler is not associated with any workbook, then default color scheme is used (default 'Office' theme and default color palette); otherwise, color scheme from the associated workbook is used.

        Specified by:
        getColors in interface FormatHandler
        Returns:
        The color scheme associated with this format handler.
